text.div:
OASIS_FU standard form version D1-012020.

Data set for use in home health agencies (HHAs), State agencies, software vendors, professional associations and other Federal agencies in implementing and maintaining OASIS.

name: OASIS_FU
publisher: Division of Chronic and Post Acute Care
title: Outcome and Assessment Information Set - Follow-up
description: Data set for use in home health agencies (HHAs), State agencies, software vendors, professional associations and other Federal agencies in implementing and maintaining OASIS.

code.display: OASIS D1 - ADL and IADLs - follow-up [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Grooming: Current ability to tend safely to personal hygiene needs (specifically: washing face and hands, hair care, shaving or make up, teeth or denture care, or fingernail care).

valueCoding.display: Able to groom self unaided, with or without the use of assistive devices or adapted methods.
Able to groom self unaided, with or without the use of assistive devices or adapted methods.
Grooming utensils must be placed within reach before able to complete grooming activities.
Grooming utensils must be placed within reach before able to complete grooming activities.
Someone must assist the {patient/resident} to groom self.
Someone must assist the patient to groom self.
{Patient/Resident} depends entirely upon someone else for grooming needs.
Patient depends entirely upon someone else for grooming needs.

item.text: Current Ability to Dress Upper Body safely (with or without dressing aids) including undergarments, pullovers, front-opening shirts and blouses, managing zippers, buttons and snaps

valueCoding.display: Able to get clothes out of closets and drawers, put them on and remove them from the upper body without assistance.
Able to get clothes out of closets and drawers, put them on and remove them from the upper body without assistance.
Able to dress upper body without assistance if clothing is laid out or handed to the {patient/resident}.
Able to dress upper body without assistance if clothing is laid out or handed to the patient.
Someone must help the {patient/resident} put on upper body clothing.
Someone must help the patient put on upper body clothing.
{Patient/Resident} depends entirely upon another person to dress the upper body.
Patient depends entirely upon another person to dress the upper body.

item.text: Current Ability to Dress Lower Body safely (with or without dressing aids) including undergarments, slacks, socks or nylons, shoes

valueCoding.display: Able to obtain, put on, and remove clothing and shoes without assistance.
Able to obtain, put on, and remove clothing and shoes without assistance.
Able to dress lower body without assistance if clothing and shoes are laid out or handed to the {patient/resident}.
Able to dress lower body without assistance if clothing and shoes are laid out or handed to the patient.
Someone must help the {patient/resident} put on undergarments, slacks, socks or nylons, and shoes.
Someone must help the patient put on undergarments, slacks, socks or nylons, and shoes.
{Patient/Resident} depends entirely upon another person to dress lower body.
Patient depends entirely upon another person to dress lower body.

item.text: Bathing: Current ability to wash entire body safely. Excludes grooming (washing face, washing hands, and shampooing hair).

valueCoding.display: Able to bathe self in shower or tub independently, including getting in and out of tub/shower.
Able to bathe self in shower or tub independently, including getting in and out of tub/shower.
With the use of devices, is able to bathe self in shower or tub independently, including getting in and out of the tub/shower.
With the use of devices, is able to bathe self in shower or tub independently, including getting in and out of the tub/shower.

Able to bathe in shower or tub with the intermittent assistance of another person:  (a) for intermittent supervision or encouragement or reminders, OR (b) to get in and out of the shower or tub, OR (c) for washing difficult to reach areas.

Able to bathe in shower or tub with the intermittent assistance of another person: (a) for intermittent supervision or encouragement or reminders, OR (b) to get in and out of the shower or tub, OR (c) for washing difficult to reach areas.
Able to participate in bathing self in shower or tub, but requires presence of another person throughout the bath for assistance or supervision.
Able to participate in bathing self in shower or tub, but requires presence of another person throughout the bath for assistance or supervision.
Unable to use the shower or tub, but able to bathe self independently with or without the use of devices at the sink, in chair, or on commode.
Unable to use the shower or tub, but able to bathe self independently with or without the use of devices at the sink, in chair, or on commode.
Unable to use the shower or tub, but able to participate in bathing self in bed, at the sink, in bedside chair, or on commode, with the assistance or supervision of another person.
Unable to use the shower or tub, but able to participate in bathing self in bed, at the sink, in bedside chair, or on commode, with the assistance or supervision of another person.
Unable to participate effectively in bathing and is bathed totally by another person.
Unable to participate effectively in bathing and is bathed totally by another person.

item.text: Toilet Transferring: Current ability to get to and from the toilet or bedside commode safely and transfer on and off toilet/commode.

valueCoding.display: Able to get to and from the toilet and transfer independently with or without a device.
Able to get to and from the toilet and transfer independently with or without a device.
When reminded, assisted, or supervised by another person, able to get to and from the toilet and transfer.
When reminded, assisted, or supervised by another person, able to get to and from the toilet and transfer.
Unable to get to and from the toilet but is able to use a bedside commode (with or without assistance).
Unable to get to and from the toilet but is able to use a bedside commode (with or without assistance).
Unable to get to and from the toilet or bedside commode but is able to use a bedpan/urinal independently.
Unable to get to and from the toilet or bedside commode but is able to use a bedpan/urinal independently.
Is totally dependent in toileting.
Is totally dependent in toileting.

item.text: Transferring: Current ability to move safely from bed to chair, or ability to turn and position self in bed if {patient/resident} is bedfast.

valueCoding.display: Able to independently transfer.
Able to independently transfer.
Able to transfer with minimal human assistance or with use of an assistive device.
Able to transfer with minimal human assistance or with use of an assistive device.
Able to bear weight and pivot during the transfer process but unable to transfer self.
Able to bear weight and pivot during the transfer process but unable to transfer self.
Unable to transfer self and is unable to bear weight or pivot when transferred by another person.
Unable to transfer self and is unable to bear weight or pivot when transferred by another person.
Bedfast, unable to transfer but is able to turn and position self in bed.
Bedfast, unable to transfer but is able to turn and position self in bed.
Bedfast, unable to transfer and is unable to turn and position self.
Bedfast, unable to transfer and is unable to turn and position self.

item.text: Ambulation/Locomotion: Current ability to walk safely, once in a standing position, or use a wheelchair, once in in a seated position, on a variety of surfaces.

valueCoding.display: Able to independently walk on even and uneven surfaces and negotiate stairs with or without railings (specifically: needs no human assistance or assistive device).
Able to independently walk on even and uneven surfaces and negotiate stairs with or without railings (specifically: needs no human assistance or assistive device).
With the use of a one-handed device (for example, cane, single crutch, hemi-walker), able to independently walk on even and uneven surfaces and negotiate stairs with or without railings.
With the use of a one-handed device (for example, cane, single crutch, hemi-walker), able to independently walk on even and uneven surfaces and negotiate stairs with or without railings.
Requires use of a two-handed device (for example, walker or crutches) to walk alone on a level surface and/or requires human supervision or assistance to negotiate stairs or steps or uneven surfaces.
Requires use of a two-handed device (for example, walker or crutches) to walk alone on a level surface and/or requires human supervision or assistance to negotiate stairs or steps or uneven surfaces.
Able to walk only with the supervision or assistance of another person at all times.
Able to walk only with the supervision or assistance of another person at all times.
Chairfast, unable to ambulate but is able to wheel self independently.
Chairfast, unable to ambulate but is able to wheel self independently.
Chairfast, unable to ambulate and is unable to wheel self.
Chairfast, unable to ambulate and is unable to wheel self.
Bedfast, unable to ambulate or be up in a chair.
Bedfast, unable to ambulate or be up in a chair.
RN
RN
PT
PT
SLP/ST
SLP/ST
OT
OT

item.text: This Assessment is Currently Being Completed for the Following Reason

valueCoding.display: Start of care - further visits planned
Start of care - further visits planned
Resumption of care (after inpatient stay)
Resumption of care (after inpatient stay)
Recertification (follow-up) reassessment
Recertification (follow-up) reassessment
Other follow-up
Other follow-up
Transferred to an inpatient facility - {patient/resident} not discharged from agency
Transferred to an inpatient facility - patient not discharged from agency
Transferred to an inpatient facility - {patient/resident} discharged from agency
Transferred to an inpatient facility - patient discharged from agency
Death at home
Death at home
Discharge from agency
Discharge from agency

item.text: Episode Timing: Is the Medicare home health payment episode for which this assessment will define a case mix group an "early" episode or a "later" episode in the {patient's/resident's} current sequence of adjacent Medicare home health payment episodes?

valueCoding.display: Early
Early
Later
Later
Unknown
Unknown
Not applicable: No Medicare case mix group to be defined by this assessment.
Not Applicable: No Medicare case mix group to be defined by this assessment.

code.display: OASIS C2, D - Elimination status - follow-up [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Urinary Incontinence or Urinary Catheter Presence

valueCoding.display: No incontinence or catheter (includes anuria or ostomy for urinary drainage)
No incontinence or catheter (includes anuria or ostomy for urinary drainage)
{Patient/Resident} is incontinent
Patient is incontinent
{Patient/Resident} requires a urinary catheter (specifically: external, indwelling, intermittent, or suprapubic)
Patient requires a urinary catheter (specifically: external, indwelling, intermittent, or suprapubic)
Very rarely or never has bowel incontinence
Very rarely or never has bowel incontinence
Less than once weekly
Less than once weekly
One to three times weekly
One to three times weekly
Four to six times weekly
Four to six times weekly
On a daily basis
On a daily basis
More often than once daily
More often than once daily
{Patient/Resident} has ostomy for bowel elimination
Patient has ostomy for bowel elimination
Unknown
Unknown

item.text: Ostomy for Bowel Elimination. Does this {patient/resident} have an ostomy for bowel elimination that (within the last 14 days): a) was related to an inpatient facility stay; or b) necessitated a change in medical or treatment regimen?

valueCoding.display: {Patient/Resident} does not have an ostomy for bowel elimination.
Patient does not have an ostomy for bowel elimination.
{Patient's/Resident's} ostomy was not related to an inpatient stay and did not necessitate change in medical or treatment regimen.
Patient's ostomy was not related to an inpatient stay and did not necessitate change in medical or treatment regimen.
The ostomy was related to an inpatient stay or did necessitate change in medical or treatment regimen.
The ostomy was related to an inpatient stay or did necessitate change in medical or treatment regimen.

item.text: Medicaid Number - Enter "+" if pending, "N" if not a Medicaid recipient

valueCoding.display: Male
Male
Female
Female

code.display: OASIS D - Integumentary status - follow-up [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Number of unstageable pressure ulcers/injuries due to non-removable dressing/device
Number of unstageable pressure ulcers due to coverage of wound bed by slough and/or eschar
Number of unstageable pressure injuries presenting as deep tissue injury

Does this {patient/resident} have at least one Unhealed Pressure Ulcer/Injury at Stage 2 or Higher or designated as Unstageable? (Excludes Stage 1 pressure injuries and all healed pressure ulcers/injuries)

valueCoding.display: No
No
Yes
Yes

item.text: Current Number of Stage 1 Pressure Injuries: Intact skin with non-blanchable redness of a localized area usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have a visible blanching; in dark skin tones only it may appear with persistent blue or purple hues.

valueCoding.display: 4 or more
4 or more

item.text: Stage of Most Problematic Unhealed Pressure Ulcer/Injury that is Stageable: (Excludes pressure ulcer/injury that cannot be staged due to a non-removable dressing/device, coverage of wound bed by slough and/or eschar, or deep tissue injury.)

valueCoding.display: Stage 1
Stage 1
Stage 2
Stage 2
Stage 3
Stage 3
Stage 4
Stage 4
{Patient/Resident} has no pressure ulcers/injuries or no stageable pressure ulcers/injuries
Patient has no pressure ulcers/injuries or no stageable pressure ulcers/injuries

item.text: Does this {patient/resident} have a Stasis Ulcer?

valueCoding.display: No
No
Yes, {patient/resident} has BOTH observable and unobservable stasis ulcers.
Yes, patient has BOTH observable and unobservable stasis ulcers
Yes, {patient/resident} has observable stasis ulcers ONLY.
Yes, patient has observable stasis ulcers ONLY
Yes, {patient/resident} has unobservable stasis ulcers ONLY (known but not observable due to non-removable dressing/device)
Yes, patient has unobservable stasis ulcers ONLY (known but not observable due to non-removable dressing/device)

item.text: Current Number of Stasis Ulcer(s) that are Observable

valueCoding.display: One
One
Two
Two
Three
Three
Four or more
Four or more

item.text: Status of Most Problematic Stasis Ulcer that is Observable

valueCoding.display: Fully granulating
Fully granulating
Early/partial granulation
Early/partial granulation
Not healing
Not healing

item.text: Does this {patient/resident} have a Surgical Wound?

valueCoding.display: No
No
Yes, {patient/resident} has at least one observable surgical wound
Yes, patient has at least one observable surgical wound
Surgical wound known but not observable due to non-removable dressing/device
Surgical wound known but not observable due to non-removable dressing/device

item.text: Status of Most Problematic Surgical Wound that is Observable

valueCoding.display: Newly epithelialized
Newly epithelialized
Fully granulating
Fully granulating
Early/partial granulation
Early/partial granulation
Not healing
Not healing

item.text: Current Number of Unhealed Pressure Ulcers/Injuries at Each Stage

code.display: OASIS C2, D - Medications - follow-up [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Management of Injectable Medications: {Patient's/Resident's} current ability to prepare and take all prescribed injectable medications reliably and safely, including administration of correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals. Excludes IV medications.

valueCoding.display: Able to independently take the correct medication(s) and proper dosage(s) at the correct times.
Able to independently take the correct medication(s) and proper dosage(s) at the correct times.
Able to take injectable medication(s) at the correct times if:  (a) individual syringes are prepared in advance by another person; OR (b) another person develops a drug diary or chart.
Able to take injectable medication(s) at the correct times if: (a) individual syringes are prepared in advance by another person; OR (b) another person develops a drug diary or chart.
Able to take medication(s) at the correct times if given reminders by another person based on the frequency of the injection
Able to take medication(s) at the correct times if given reminders by another person based on the frequency of the injection
Unable to take injectable medication unless administered by another person.
Unable to take injectable medication unless administered by another person.
No injectable medications prescribed.
No injectable medications prescribed.

code.display: OASIS D1 - Patient history and diagnoses - follow-up [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Primary Diagnosis.  Sequencing of diagnoses should reflect the seriousness of each condition and support the disciplines and services provided.

valueCoding.display: Asymptomatic, no treatment needed at this time
Asymptomatic, no treatment needed at this time
Symptoms well controlled with current therapy
Symptoms well controlled with current therapy

item.text: Therapies the {patient/resident} receives at home. Mark all that apply

valueCoding.display: Intravenous or infusion therapy (excludes TPN)
Intravenous or infusion therapy (excludes TPN)
Parenteral nutrition (TPN or lipids)
Parenteral nutrition (TPN or lipids)
Enteral nutrition (nasogastric, gastrostomy, jejunostomy, or any other artificial entry into the alimentary canal)
Enteral nutrition (nasogastric, gastrostomy, jejunostomy, or any other artificial entry into the alimentary canal)
None of the above
None of the above

item.text: Risk for Hospitalization: Which of the following signs or symptoms characterize this {patient/resident} as at risk for hospitalization? Mark all that apply

valueCoding.display: History of falls (2 or more falls - or any fall with an injury - in the past 12 months)
History of falls (2 or more falls - or any fall with an injury - in the past 12 months)
Unintentional weight loss of a total of 10 pounds or more in the past 12 months
Unintentional weight loss of a total of 10 pounds or more in the past 12 months
Multiple hospitalizations (2 or more) in the past 6 months
Multiple hospitalizations (2 or more) in the past 6 months
Multiple emergency department visits (2 or more) in the past 6 months
Multiple emergency department visits (2 or more) in the past 6 months
Decline in mental, emotional, or behavioral status in the past 3 months
Decline in mental, emotional, or behavioral status in the past 3 months
Reported or observed history of difficulty complying with any medical instructions (for example, medications, diet, exercise) in the past 3 months
Reported or observed history of difficulty complying with any medical instructions (for example, medications, diet, exercise) in the past 3 months
Currently taking 5 or more medications
Currently taking 5 or more medications
Currently reports exhaustion
Currently reports exhaustion
Other risk(s) not listed in 1 - 8
Other risk(s) not listed in 1 - 8
None of the above
None of the above

code.display: OASIS C2, D - Respiratory status - follow-up or discharge [CMS Assessment]

item.text: When is the {patient/resident} dyspneic or noticeably Short of Breath?

valueCoding.display: {Patient/Resident} is not short of breath
Patient is not short of breath
When walking more than 20 feet, climbing stairs
When walking more than 20 feet, climbing stairs
With moderate exertion (for example, while dressing, using commode or bedpan, walking distances less than 20 feet)
With moderate exertion (for example, while dressing, using commode or bedpan, walking distances less than 20 feet)
With minimal exertion (for example, while eating, talking, or performing other ADLs) or with agitation
With minimal exertion (for example, while eating, talking, or performing other ADLs) or with agitation
At rest (during day or night)
At rest (during day or night)

item.text: Section GG: Functional Abilities and Goals

code.display: OASIS D - Functional abilities and goals - follow-up [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Self-Care. Code the {patient's/resident's} usual performance at Follow-Up for each activity using the 6-point scale.  If activity was not attempted at Follow-Up code the reason.
Mobility. Code the {patient's/resident's} usual performance at Follow-up for each activity using the 6-point scale. If activity was not attempted at Follow-up code the reason.
Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to the mouth and swallow food and/or liquid once a mean is placed before the {patient/resident}. - Follow-up Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - {Patient/Resident} completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Independent - Patient completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; {patient/resident} completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; patient completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.

Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as {patient/resident} completes activity. Assistance may be provided throughout the activity or intermittently.

Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as patient completes activity. Assistance may be provided throughout the activity or intermittently.
Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does less than half the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does MORE THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does more than half the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.

Dependent - Helper does ALL of the effort. {Patient/Resident} does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the {patient/resident} to complete the activity.
Dependent - Helper does all of the effort. Patient does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the patient to complete the activity.
{Patient/Resident} refused
Patient refused
Not applicable - Not attempted and the {patient/resident} did not perform this activity prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.
Not applicable - Not attempted and the patient did not perform this activity prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.
Not attempted due to environmental limitations (e.g., lack of equipment, weather constraints)
Not attempted due to environmental limitations (e.g., lack of equipment, weather constraints).
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

item.text: Oral Hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures into and from the mouth, and manage denture soaking and rinsing with use of equipment. - Follow-up Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - {Patient/Resident} completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Independent - Patient completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; {patient/resident} completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.

Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as {patient/resident} completes activity. Assistance may be provided throughout the activity or intermittently.

Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does less than half the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does MORE THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does more than half the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.

Dependent - Helper does ALL of the effort. {Patient/Resident} does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the {patient/resident} to complete the activity.
Dependent - Helper does all of the effort. Patient does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the patient to complete the activity.
{Patient/Resident} refused
Patient refused
Not applicable - Not attempted and the {patient/resident} did not perform this activity prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.
Not applicable - Not attempted and the patient did not perform this activity prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.
Not attempted due to environmental limitations (e.g., lack of equipment, weather constraints)
Not attempted due to environmental limitations (e.g., lack of equipment, weather constraints).

item.text: Toileting Hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal hygiene, adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening but not managing equipment. - Follow-up Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - {Patient/Resident} completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Independent - Patient completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; {patient/resident} completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; patient completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.

Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as {patient/resident} completes activity. Assistance may be provided throughout the activity or intermittently.

Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as patient completes activity. Assistance may be provided throughout the activity or intermittently.
Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does LESS THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does less than half the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does MORE THAN HALF the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.
Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does more than half the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.

Dependent - Helper does ALL of the effort. {Patient/Resident} does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the {patient/resident} to complete the activity.
Dependent - Helper does all of the effort. Patient does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the patient to complete the activity.

item.text: Roll left and right: The ability to roll from lying on back to left and right side, and return to lying on back on the bed. - Follow-up Performance

valueCoding.display: Independent - {Patient/Resident} completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Independent - Patient completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; {patient/resident} completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.
Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; patient completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.

item.text: Therapy Need and Plan of Care

code.display: OASIS D - Therapy need and plan of care [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Therapy Need: In the home health plan of care for the Medicare payment episode for which this assessment will define a case mix group, what is the indicated need for therapy visits (total of reasonable and necessary physical, occupational, and speech-language pathology visits combined)? Enter zero ["000"] if no therapy visits indicated.
